cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.ST. 

The paper deals with a regularization principle for classification, which is a common topic in machine learning and statistics. The use of marginal distributions and Tikhonov regularization suggests a focus on learning from unlabeled data, which is a common problem in semi-supervised learning and unsupervised learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also mentions sample complexity and information theory, which are relevant to cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.ST (Statistics).
